ResourceHeader.ResourceName: MMS 2 Fast Plasma Investigation, Dual Electron Spectrometer (FPI, DES) Instrument Distributions, Level 2 (L2), Burst Mode, 30 ms Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata
Added DOI and PublicationInfo minted by LFB, updated the RepositoryID, updated the SPDF MetadataContact Person to Robert M. Candey, metadata updated to SPASE 2.4.1, reviewed by LFB 20220803

Standardized the ResourceName Format, Set AlternateName equal to the ProductKey, Revised the Acknowledgement, PublicationInfo Authors, and Contact Person list per request of the MMS FPI team, metadata updated to SPASE 2.5.0, reviewed by LFB 20230304
Remove Stephen Kreisler from Author and Acknowledgment lists per request of the MMS FPI team, revised by LFB 20230328

ResourceHeader.Description: The Fast Plasma Instrument (FPI) usually Operates in Fast Survey (FS) Mode in the MMS Region Of Interest (ROI) for the current Mission Phase. Data are taken at Burst (30/150 ms for DES/DIS) Resolution in this Mode. Data are also made available at Survey (4.5 s, etc.) Resolution. Per Mission Design, not all Burst Resolution Data are downlinked, but all Survey Data are downlinked. This Product contains Phase Space Distribution Maps of those Burst Resolution Data selected for downlink. In particular, the (highest possible Quality at the Time of Release) corrected/converted "Burst Sky Map" Distributions are reported with Time Stamps and other Annotation characterizing the State of the Instrument System at the indicated Time.

NumericalData.Caveats: This SPASE Numerical Data Description is for the MMS2_FPI_BRST_L2_DES-DIST Data Product. This Numerical Data Description has been written by utilizing the ADAPT Software Package. ADAPT can harvest Metadata that are embedded in Data Files stored in Common Data File Format that are then leveraged to populate corresponding SPASE Schema Text Fields. Typically, the CDF embedded Metadata are harvested from CDF Master Files, which contain no actual Data, in order to populate SPASE Documents. In this case, the Metadata were harvested from a "Data" CDF, which contains actual Data Observations from one of the four MMS FPI Instruments. The "Data" CDF used by ADAPT has the following Specifications: Data Product Version Number: 3.3.0, CDF Generation Date: 2018-11-03T05:10:22, CDF Skeleton Version Revision Number: 8026, and CDF Skeleton Version Revision Date: 2017-05-26T15:45:00.

Parameter.Name: Epoch Time
Parameter.Description: Epoch Time Tags in Terrestrial Time 2000 (TT2000), Nanoseconds since J2000
Parameter.Caveats: Burst Data Begin Time, derived from the Burst Packet Time. This Parameter exhibits an increasing Monotonic Progression.

Parameter.Name: Data Quality Error Flags
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Vector of Data Quality Indicator Flag Flags at Burst Start Time
Parameter.Caveats: A Value of Zero signifies no Quality Errors. For Non-Zero Values: Bit-0=Manually flagged Interval, Bit-1=Overcounting/Saturation Effects likely present in Sky Map, Bit-2=Compression Pipeline Error

Parameter.Name: Compression Flag
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Compression Lossless/Lossy Indicator Flag at Survey Start Time

Parameter.Name: Step Table Parity
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Caveats: The FPI/DES alternates between two Tables, designated "even" (0) and "odd" (1).

Parameter.Name: Start Del-Phi Count
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Del-Phi (Observatory Spin Phase) Count at Burst Start Time
Parameter.Caveats: Nominally, the Spin Phase Counts range over [0000,5759] Counts. Each Count represents 1/16 of a Degree (0.0625°) of Observatory Spin Phase. Zero Spin Phase Angle indicates that the Observatory +X-axis is aligned with the Sun Sensor Axis.

Parameter.Name: Start Del-Phi Angle
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Del-Phi (Observatory Spin Phase) Angle at Burst Start Time
Parameter.Caveats: Nominally, the Spin Phase Angles range over [0°,360°). Each Count represents 1/16 of a Degree (0.0625°) of Observatory Spin Phase. Zero Spin Phase Angle indicates that the Observatory +X-axis is aligned with the Sun Sensor Axis.

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Azimuth Angle, Phi
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Electron Burst Survey Sky Map Azimuth Angle, Phi
Parameter.Caveats: Azimuth Angles in the Instrument Frame, i.e., the Azimuthal Angle of the Instrument Look Direction

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Azimuth Angle, Phi, Delta Value
Parameter.Description: Electron Burst Survey Sky Map Azimuth Angle, Phi, Bin Delta Value

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Distribution
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Electron Burst Survey Sky Map Instrument Distribution. Column 1 Labels from MMS2_DES_PHI_BRST: ["sector00","sector01","sector02","sector03","sector04","sector05","sector06","sector07","sector08","sector09","sector10","sector11","sector12","sector13","sector14","sector15","sector16","sector17","sector18","sector19","sector20","sector21","sector22","sector23","sector24","sector25","sector26","sector27","sector28","sector29","sector30","sector31"]. Column 2 Labels from MMS2_DES_THETA_BRST: ["5.6250 deg","16.875 deg","28.125 deg","39.375 deg","50.625 deg","61.875 deg","73.125 deg","84.375 deg","95.625 deg","106.88 deg","118.13 deg","129.38 deg","140.63 deg","151.88 deg","163.13 deg","174.38 deg"]. Column 3 Labels from MMS2_DES_ENERGY_BRST: ["energy00","energy01","energy02","energy03","energy04","energy05","energy06","energy07","energy08","energy09","energy10","energy11","energy12","energy13","energy14","energy15","energy16","energy17","energy18","energy19","energy20","energy21","energy22","energy23","energy24","energy25","energy26","energy27","energy28","energy29","energy30","energy31"].
Parameter.Caveats: Azimuth Bin: Sector Index=00 looks "after" (Spin Phase) the Sun Direction, ..., Sector Index=31 looks "before" the Sun Direction. Head Field of View: Pixel Index=00 looks to Zenith, ..., Pixel Index=15 looks to Nadir. FPI Operations nominally bin Data from 64 Energy Filters into 32 pairwise Energy Bins, indexed 00-31. Nominally, Bins are indexed in increasing Energy Order. See the FPI Documents for Details.

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Distribution, Error
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Electron Burst Survey Sky Map Instrument Distribution, 1-sigma Error. Column 1 Labels from MMS2_DES_PHI_BRST: ["sector00","sector01","sector02","sector03","sector04","sector05","sector06","sector07","sector08","sector09","sector10","sector11","sector12","sector13","sector14","sector15","sector16","sector17","sector18","sector19","sector20","sector21","sector22","sector23","sector24","sector25","sector26","sector27","sector28","sector29","sector30","sector31"]. Column 2 Labels from MMS2_DES_THETA_BRST: ["5.6250 deg","16.875 deg","28.125 deg","39.375 deg","50.625 deg","61.875 deg","73.125 deg","84.375 deg","95.625 deg","106.88 deg","118.13 deg","129.38 deg","140.63 deg","151.88 deg","163.13 deg","174.38 deg"]. Column 3 Labels from MMS2_DES_ENERGY_BRST: ["energy00","energy01","energy02","energy03","energy04","energy05","energy06","energy07","energy08","energy09","energy10","energy11","energy12","energy13","energy14","energy15","energy16","energy17","energy18","energy19","energy20","energy21","energy22","energy23","energy24","energy25","energy26","energy27","energy28","energy29","energy30","energy31"].
Parameter.Caveats: Azimuth Bin: Sector Index=00 looks "after" (Spin Phase) the Sun Direction, ..., Sector Index=31 looks "before" the Sun Direction. Head Field of View: Pixel Index=00 looks to Zenith, ..., Pixel Index=15 looks to Nadir. FPI Operations nominally bin Data from 64 Energy Filters into 32 pairwise Energy Bins, indexed 00-31. Nominally, Bins are indexed in increasing Energy Order. See the FPI Documents for Details.

Parameter.Name: Sector De-Spin P Value
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Sector De-Spin P Value, this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: This Variable records the P-Value used to De-Spin this Burst Sky Map onboard. See the FPI Documents for Details.

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Zenith Angle, Theta
Parameter.Description: Electron Burst Survey Sky Map Zenith Angle, Theta
Parameter.Caveats: Pixel Zenith Angles, i.e., the Polar Angle of the Instrument Look Direction

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Zenith Angle, Theta, Delta Value
Parameter.Description: Electron Burst Survey Sky Map Zenith Angle, Theta, Bin Delta Value

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Energy
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Electron Burst Survey Sky Map Parity 0/1 Energy
Parameter.Caveats: Energies (Parity 0/1) in the 64-step FPI Energy Table

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Energy, Delta Value
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Electron Burst Survey Sky Map Energy, Delta Value
Parameter.Caveats: Note that the Deltas are provided to indicate that the FPI is reporting the Energy Bin Centers. The Deltas do not necessarily reflect the Energy Bandwidth that is sampled by the FPI for a given Energy Step.
